definitions.definition: The sense or ability of sight.
Something seen; an object perceived visually.
Something imaginary one thinks one sees.
definitions.example: He tried drinking from the pool of water, but realized it was only a vision.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Something unreal or imaginary; a creation of fancy.
An ideal or a goal toward which one aspires.
definitions.example: He worked tirelessly toward his vision of world peace.

definitions.definition: A religious or mystical experience of a supernatural appearance.
definitions.example: He had a vision of the Virgin Mary.

definitions.definition: A person or thing of extraordinary beauty.
To imagine something as if it were to be true.
To present as in a vision.
